meanings.definition: Tending to be uncooperative or hesitant
meanings.sent1: The baulky horse refused to cross the stream.
meanings.sent2: The baulky child didn't want to try the new food.
meanings.sent3: The baulky computer mouse kept freezing at the worst times.
meanings.sent4: Her baulky attitude was like a locked door, impossible to open.
meanings.sent5: The baulky engine sputtered and stalled on the steep hill.

meanings.sent1: Despite the baulky door, he finally managed to open it.
meanings.sent2: The baulky old tractor needed a lot of coaxing to start.
meanings.sent3: The baulky cat refused to move from its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: Her baulky determination was like a mountain, unyielding and strong.
meanings.sent5: The baulky lock on the gate wouldn't budge no matter how hard she tried.

meanings.sent1: The baulky student hesitated before answering the question.
meanings.sent2: She gave a baulky response when asked to help with the project.
meanings.sent3: The baulky cat pretended not to hear its owner calling.
meanings.sent4: His baulky mood hung over the room like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The baulky clouds refused to part, keeping the sun hidden all day.
